title: Sorting Algorithms
concept: This level teaches how sorting works internally. Focus is on writing logic without library sort functions. Problems include implementing Bubble Sort, Selection Sort, Insertion Sort, checking sorted, sorting strings, sorting pairs and stable sorting logic.

challenges.title: Sort Array (Ascending)
challenges.description: Read N and N integers. Sort the array in ascending order using any sorting logic and print.
challenges.starterCode: // sort array without using built-in sort

challenges.title: Sort Array (Descending)
challenges.description: Sort given array in descending order and print.

challenges.title: Bubble Sort Simulation
challenges.description: Apply Bubble Sort and print the final sorted array.

challenges.title: Selection Sort Simulation
challenges.description: Apply Selection Sort and print the final sorted array.

challenges.title: Insertion Sort Simulation
challenges.description: Apply Insertion Sort and print the final sorted array.

challenges.title: Sort 0s and 1s
challenges.description: Given array containing only 0 and 1, sort without full sorting (count or two-pointer).

challenges.title: Sort by Absolute Value
challenges.description: Sort array by absolute values (e.g., -2 before -5 because |-2| < |-5|).

challenges.title: Sort Strings (Lexicographically)
challenges.description: Sort N strings in dictionary order.
challenges.starterCode: // sort array of strings without builtin sort

challenges.title: Sort Pairs by First Value
challenges.description: Given N pairs (x, y), sort in ascending order of x. If x ties, maintain order of input (stable sort).
challenges.starterCode: // stable sort on first element only

challenges.title: Kth Smallest
challenges.description: Given array and K (1-indexed), sort and print the Kth smallest element.
